description: System-generated unique identifier for the asset type record used as the primary key and for foreign key references.
Business identifier for the asset type used by users, reports, and integrations; typically a short code.
Human-readable description of the asset type, often including make, model, or category details.
Optional free-text notes about the asset type, such as usage, constraints, or other relevant details.
System-maintained timestamp of the most recent update to this record, regardless of user.
Likely expected lower bound of consumable fluid per event for this asset type; units defined elsewhere; confirm with SME.
Likely expected upper bound of consumable fluid per event for this asset type; units defined elsewhere; confirm with SME.
Likely typical average amount of consumable fluid used per event for this asset type; units defined elsewhere; confirm with SME.
Expected rate of consumable fluid usage per unit of distance for this asset type (e.g., gallons per mile); confirm units with SME.
Maximum typical distance between tracked fluid events or measurements for this asset type (e.g., miles before refuel/service); confirm intent and units with SME.
Legacy or user-facing timestamp of the last modification to this record; may differ from the system last-modified field; confirm lineage.
User account that created this record; used for audit tracking.
Timestamp when this record was initially created by a user or process.
User account that most recently modified this record; used for audit tracking.
Timestamp of the most recent user-driven modification to this record.
